Since the diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular bisectors of each other, they form four right-angled triangles inside the rhombus. Using the Pythagorean theorem (a² + b² = c²) in one of these triangles, where 'a' and 'b' are half the lengths of 'p' and 'q' and 'c' is the side of the rhombus, we get (p/2)² + (q/2)² = a².
